newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SANDERINK BEHEER MAKES BID FOR MULTIHOUSE.
newsitem.headline: SANDERINK BEHEER MAKES BID FOR MULTIHOUSE.

text.p: Dutch Sanderink Beheer and information technology company Multihouse said on Friday Sanderink was making a bid of 0.70 guilders per share for Multihouse.
Multihouse was forced to seek corporate protection from creditors in April after Dutch utility companies filed a claim for damages worth 170 million guilders.
It said earlier in May it was also seeking a company which was willing to take it over.
Multihouse shares were suspended early on Friday and closed at 1.70 guilders on Thursday.
Sanderink Beheer N.V. is composed of six specialised Information-Technology companies.
Companies under the Sanderink umbrella employ some 900 people and have an annual turnover of over 125 million guilders.
Sanderink and Multihouse said their customer target groups were similar and combining the companies would strengthen each other in the field of automisation services.
Multihouse will be an autonomous unit within the Sanderink's group structure, after finalisation of the bid, Multihouse said. It said no immediate job cuts were foreseen.
